Class Planet

java.lang.Object
  Planet

public class Planet
extends Object

Planet --- class to calculate and display location of planet objects

Author:
Jose Romero

          Calculates the force between two Planet objects in the x-direction

 void display()
          Draws the current planet with positionX and positionY

Constructor Detail

Planet

public Planet(double px,
              double py,
              double vx,
              double vy,
              double m,
              String file)
Constructor assigns attributes to appropriate values

Parameters:
px - A double with the value of the x-position of the Planet object py A double with the value of the y-position of the Planet object vx A double with the value of the x-velocity of the Planet object vy A double with the value of the y-velcoity of the Planet object m A double with the value of the mass of the Planet object file A String containing the name of the picture of the Planet object
Method Detail

calculateFX

public double calculateFX(Planet other)
Calculates the force between two Planet objects in the x-direction

Parameters:
other - A Planet object containing the position of the planet
Returns:
Returns the force applied on the planet in the x-direction as a double
Throws:

calculateFY

public double calculateFY(Planet other)
Calculates the force between two Planet objects in the y-direction

Parameters:
other - A Planet object containing the position of the planet
Returns:
Returns the force applied on the planet in the y-direction
Throws:

Draws the current planet with positionX and positionY

Throws:

updatePosition

public void updatePosition(double fx,
                           double fy,
                           double dt)
Updates the position and velocity of the planet

Parameters:
fx - A double containing the net force in the x-direction fy A double containing the net force in the y-direction, dt A double containing the interval of time passed
Throws:
